meanings.definition: The course or path that a person or thing is moving or facing.
meanings.sent1: She followed the map to find the right direction.
meanings.sent2: The sign pointed in the direction of the beach.
meanings.sent3: The lost puppy went in the opposite direction of home.
meanings.sent4: His career took a new direction after he changed jobs.
meanings.sent5: The stars in the sky guided their direction through the forest.

meanings.definition: Guidance or instruction on how to do something.
meanings.sent1: The teacher gave clear direction on the science experiment.
meanings.sent2: Following the recipe's direction, she baked a delicious cake.
meanings.sent3: The robot followed the programmer's direction perfectly.
meanings.sent4: His father's wise direction helped him make the right choice.
meanings.sent5: The coach's direction improved the team's performance.

meanings.definition: The position towards which someone or something moves or faces.
meanings.sent1: The compass always points north as the main direction.
meanings.sent2: She turned her head in the direction of the noise.
meanings.sent3: The cat pounced in the direction of the moving toy.
meanings.sent4: The ship sailed towards the direction of the setting sun.
meanings.sent5: The detective followed the suspect's direction to the hidden treasure.
